name: OpenCTI
description: Open-source cyber threat intelligence platform — threat actors, IOCs, MITRE ATT&CK mappings, and campaign tracking

tools: search_indicators — Search IOCs (IPs, domains, hashes, URLs)
get_threat_actor — Get threat actor details and TTPs
search_malware — Search malware families and samples
get_vulnerability — Get vulnerability details and context

setup_steps: 2. Configure connectors for threat feeds (AlienVault OTX, MITRE, etc.)
3. Create API token: Settings → Users → Create token
4. Set OPENCTI_URL to your instance (e.g., https://opencti.company.com)
5. Ensure connectors are syncing data before using MCP
security_notes: Self-hosted — all data stays on your infrastructure
API token should have Analyst role (read-only)
OpenCTI can contain sensitive intelligence — restrict MCP access appropriately
Verify connector data quality — garbage in = garbage out for AI analysis
